SUMMARY #

                    Text: 
                    New, Vintage, and Signed Blotter Art

Contribute $50 or more and get a piece of displayable blotter art. These look great framed on the wall !

Hydrocodone

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Hydrocodone Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? NO Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? Sometimes Possible to Test for? YES Detection Period in Urine 3-4 days

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing


                    Context: 
                    This section provides an overview of hydrocodone detection in drug testing, summarizing whether hydrocodone is tested for in standard or extended drug screens, its urine detection window, and relevant testing methods, as part of Erowid's comprehensive drug testing information on pharmaceuticals.

metadata.title: Erowid Hydrocodone Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Hydrocodone and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Hydrocodone | cid: 5284569
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Hydrocodone and drug tests.
Erowid name: hydrocodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing

Hydrocodone may not cause a positive result in a standard opiate urine test. Many opiate tests test only for morphine (which both codeine and heroin break down into). This is true for both home/business kits and laboratory testing. Hydrocodone does not break down into morphine, and is therefore not detected by these tests. But home and laboratory testing is available that will detect hydrocodone (and hydromorphone, which it breaks down into). So test results will depend on the particular type of test that is used and whether or not laboratory verification is required. If a home drug test is given and the opiate test shows a positive result (due to hydromorphone use), a laboratory verification might NOT result in a positive test because the lab may only test for morphine. In this case, the lab would NOT be able to verify the original positive result.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This section explains how hydrocodone is detected in urine drug testing, clarifying that it may not show up on standard opiate tests because these typically only detect morphine metabolites. It details the limitations of home and laboratory tests, the factors influencing test results, and the circumstances in which hydrocodone or its metabolite hydromorphone can be detected. This information is part of Erowid's broader guide to drug testing, specifically under the hydrocodone drug testing summary.

metadata.title: Erowid Hydrocodone Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Hydrocodone and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Hydrocodone | cid: 5284569
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Hydrocodone and drug tests.
Erowid name: hydrocodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

Drug Testing Vault

OFF-SITE RESOURCES #

                    Context: 
                    This section appears at the end of Erowid's "Hydrocodone Drug Testing" page, directly following the summary of how hydrocodone is detected (or not) in standard and extended drug tests. It provides a cautionary disclaimer about the variability and limitations of drug testing information, outlines individual factors that affect detection, and offers links to related resources for further information.
